definition: foot/leg (of an animal or an object)/base (of an object)/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]/classifier for kicks

sentences.english: Isadora liked to move her arms and legs in very smooth motions.

sentences.english: The men in recon were clumsy now and uncertain of their footing .
sentences.chinese: 偵察排的戰士到這時候又都腿腳不靈，步履不穩了。

sentences.english: You might as well call a taxi because your legs are weak.
sentences.chinese: 你不妨坐出租車，因爲你的腿腳行動不方便。

sentences.english: They result from recurrent infections and insults to the feet and legs.
sentences.chinese: 他們常起源於腿腳反覆感染和受侵犯。

sentences.english: Hold the position that curves leg calcaneal and press close to of unbend leg photograph next.
sentences.chinese: 然後抓住彎曲腿腳跟與伸直腿相貼近的位置。

sentences.english: Most ticks are probably picked up on the lower legs and then crawl up the body seeking a place to feed.
sentences.chinese: 大多數蜱蟲從腿腳處下上爬，尋找下手處。

sentences.english: Regular is dropsy of ability to walk why?
sentences.chinese: 經常性腿腳浮腫是爲什麼？

definition: to fiddle with/to tamper with/to meddle with/to move randomly/to flail about
to act with confusion/to be in a flurry/to be flustered
